Gloss-en: The place where a person or organization can be found or communicated with.
Character on stage or appear in a play, etc.
Be present at (meetings, church services, university), etc.
Being derived from (often followed by 'on' or 'upon').
Date of birth.
Overlaid or spread or topped with or enclosed within something; sometimes used as a combining form.
The end date and time of the item.
Something that happens at a given place and time.
The name used to identify the members of a family (as distinguished from each member's given name).
The name that precedes the surname.
Represents a guest or participant involved in a sports event.
The person's occupation.
Have or possess, either in a concrete or an abstract sense.
Evidence of identity; something that identifies a person or thing (full form of 'id').
Provided with artificial light.
A determination of the place where something is.
An urban district having corporate status and powers of self-government.
A language unit by which a person or thing is known.
Create (as an entity).
The persons (or committees or departments etc.) who make up a body for the purpose of administering something.
A court dedicated to padel, a racquet sport.
Situated in a particular spot or position.
Participate in games or sport.
An active diversion requiring physical exertion and competition.
The start date and time of the item.
Describes the surface of a feature.
A court dedicated to tennis.
A person who makes use of a thing; someone who uses or employs something.
A field dedicated to volleyball.
